background: Ereshkigal is the goddess of the underworld in Mesopotamian mythology, reigning over the resting place of the dead as its supreme ruler.
She is the older sister of Ishtar, their relationship a tangled mix of rivalry and subtle bonds due to their opposing natures and duties.

In Fate/Grand Order, she manifests as a Lancer class Servant, forming a profound connection with the protagonist Fujimaru Ritsuka, especially evident in the Babylonia chapter where she reveals her gentleness and solitude toward humanity.

Bound to the underworld since her inception, surrounded only by silent souls and cold darkness, this environment forged her contradictory nature—yearning for companionship yet accustomed to isolation.

Significant experiences include her mythological marriage to Nergal, the god of plague and war, and her sacrificial moment in the game to protect humanity, deepening her complex emotions toward life and death.
